alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Orleans and southeastern St. Tammany Parishes through 1145 PM CDT... At 1113 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Catherine, or 10 miles south of Slidell, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 45 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated and storm history of producing dime sized hail over Eden Isle. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans and Lake Catherine. This includes Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 252 and 256. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: High winds will be likely for those along shorelines, seek shelter inside until the storm passes. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
